text: In Greek mythology, Amphissus was the son of Apollo and Dryope. He eventually built a temple to his father in the city he founded, Amphissa. == Mythology == Apollo found Dryope tending her sheep on a mountainside. She was accompanied by other dryads. He hid behind a tree and watched her. He disguised himself as a turtle in order for her to get closer to her. She claimed the turtle as hers. Then, to scare away the other dryads, Apollo turned into a snake to chased them away and coupled with Dryope. This is how she came with child, Amphissus.Antoninus Liberalis, 32. ==Note== == Reference == * Antoninus Liberalis, The Metamorphoses of Antoninus Liberalis translated by Francis Celoria (Routledge 1992).
